revised_title: Temperature Independence of the de Haas-van Alphen Amplitude in Mercury
tldr: The authors studied the amplitude of the de Haas-van Alphen effect in mercury at different temperatures and magnetic fields. They found that the amplitude remained independent of temperature, contrary to expectations. This surprising result can be explained by a many-body theory of electron-phonon scattering on the de Haas-van Alphen amplitude.
